page.title: 11Local History of Fenton
page.content: The Foss Dyke links the Trent at Torksey and the Witham at Lincoln.It is said to be the oldest navigable waterway in the country, originating from Roman times. It is interesting to note that the name Fenton is derived from the Saxon term "fen farm".It was a thriving community one hundred years ago with two grocers,two public houses, a butcher, a tailor, a blacksmith, a brickyard and two wheelwrights. The Wesleyan Chapel is now used by a potato merchant as a warehouse. In 1852 a steam engine was used for draining the land.
